sec.p: First, the prepared N-CQDs were tested with high-resolution TEM. As shown in Figure 2a, there was no significant lattice stripe of N-CQDs, which indicated that the prepared N-CQDs were amorphous structures. As can be seen from the FT-IR spectra ( Figure 2b), the functional groups of N-CQDs were mainly amine (3421 cm −1), methylene (2895, 2965 cm −1), and amide carbonyl (1716 cm −1), and the chemical bonds were C=C (1458, 1507 cm −1), C–N (1410 cm -1), aromatic C–NH (1271 cm −1), and C–O (1097 cm −1). XPS measurements were carried out to probe the N atoms in the N-CQDs. XPS full-scan spectra showed three peaks around 284.8, 399.3, and 532 eV that were ascribed to carbon, nitrogen, and oxygen, respectively ( Figure 2c). As shown in Figure 2c,d, there was no significant difference in the concentrations of N1s at depths of 10, 20, and 30 nm from the N-CQDs surface. This indicates that the internal structure of the prepared N-CQDs was uniform. The content of N was about 16% (N/C atomic ratio is about 20.0%), which is much higher than that of various N-doped graphene-based materials (0.3–8.3%) [ 43, 44, 45, 46]. Elemental analysis indicated that the prepared N-CQDs contained about 19% of nitrogen element.
